ABSOLVED.Defintion: (especially in religion or law) to free someone from guilt, blame, or responsibility for something

ALLIED.Defintion: relating to the Allies (= the countries that fought against Germany and the other Axis countries in the Second World War)

ALLIES.Defintion: a country that has agreed officially to give help and support to another one, especially during a war

ANTICIPATE.Defintion: to imagine or expect that something will happen

ASSEMBLED.Defintion: to come together in a single place or bring parts together in a single group

BREAK OUT.Defintion: If something dangerous or unpleasant breaks out, it suddenly starts

BUZZWORD.Defintion: a word or expression from a particular subject area that has become fashionable by being used a lot, especially on television and in the newspapers

CASTRATION.Defintion: the process of removing the testicles of a male animal or human

CHAIN.Defintion: (a length of) rings usually made of metal that are connected together and used for fastening, pulling, supporting, or limiting freedom, or as jewellery

CONTAINED.Defintion: didn't go over a large distance, kept within a small area

CONVICTED.Defintion: having officially been found guilty of a crime in a law court

CORRESPOND.Defintion: to match or be similar or equal

CRYPTOGRAPHY.Defintion: the practice of creating and understanding codes that keep information secret

CYANIDE.Defintion: an extremely powerful poison that can kill people

DECIPHER.Defintion: to discover the meaning of something written badly or in a difficult or hidden way

DECIPHERING.Defintion: to discover the meaning of something written badly or in a difficult or hidden way

DEEMED.Defintion: to consider or judge something in a particular way

ECCENTRIC.Defintion: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way

EMERGE.Defintion: to appear by coming out of something or out from behind something

ENCRYPTED.Defintion: to change electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use on normal equipment

ENCRYPTING.Defintion: to change electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use on normal equipment

ENSURING.Defintion: to make something certain to happen

ERA.Defintion: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

ESPIONAGE.Defintion: the discovering of secrets, especially political or military information of another country or the industrial information of a business

EVENTUAL.Defintion: happening or existing at a later time or at the end, especially after a lot of effort, problems, etc.

FOR THAT MATTER.Defintion: used to show that a statement is true in another situation

IMPENDING.Defintion: used to refer to an event, usually something unpleasant or unwanted, that is going to happen soon

IMPOTENT.Defintion: If a man is impotent, he cannot have sex because his penis cannot become hard or stay hard

IN INVERTED COMMAS.Defintion: used in spoken English after a word or phrase to show that it has not been used accurately or that the opposite meaning is intended

LISTENING IN.Defintion: If you listen in on a conversation or on someone talking, you listen, especially secretly, without saying anything

MAKE UP.Defintion: to take the place of something lost or damaged or to compensate for something bad with something good

MORSE CODE.Defintion: a system used for sending messages, in which letters and numbers are represented by short and long marks, sounds, or flashes of light

NONE OTHER.Defintion: said when you want to show that someone or something is a surprising or exciting choice or example

NOT SO FAST.Defintion: used in speech to say that one disagrees with what someone has said or to tell someone to stop or slow down

OESTROGEN.Defintion: a female hormone that causes development and change in the reproductive organs (= organs involved in producing babies)

OUTBREAK.Defintion: a time when something suddenly begins, especially a disease or something else dangerous or unpleasant

OVERHEARD.Defintion: to hear what other people are saying without intending to and without their knowledge

PARDONED.Defintion: If someone who has committed a crime is pardoned, that person is officially forgiven and their punishment is stopped

PARTIES.Defintion: one of the people or groups of people involved in an official argument, arrangement, or similar situation

PATTERN.Defintion: a particular way in which something is done, is organised, or happens

PRINCIPLES.Defintion: a basic idea or rule that explains or controls how something happens or works

RADIATOR.Defintion: a device, usually a container filled with water, that sends out heat, often as part of a heating or cooling system

SERIES.Defintion: a number of similar or related events or things, one following another

SINKING.Defintion: causing a ship to sink (to go below the surface of the water)

STRETCH OUT.Defintion: to cause something to reach, often as far as possible, in a particular direction

TANKS.Defintion: a large military fighting vehicle designed to protect those inside it from attack, driven by wheels that turn inside moving metal belts

TELL A MACHINE APART.Defintion: tell the difference between a machine and something else

TISSUE.Defintion: a group of connected cells in an animal or plant that are similar to each other, have the same purpose, and form the stated part of the animal or plant

TRAGIC.Defintion: very sad, often involving death and suffering

YOU CAN BET.Defintion: used to say that you are completely certain that something is true or will happen
